title: Smartgoat
author: Smartgoat
content: Let me use this medium to retroduce my self again, I'm smartgoat. I have been on this forum for pass 6days now without knowing that, there is a place called beginners and help here. I'm here on this forum to learn, to know, and to succeed. I know nothing about Bitcoin, but I'm here to learn of bitcoins and to make progress on it. And for me to succeed here, it requires everybody to guild and direct me to learn and master everything about Bitcoin.I know quite well that others who are professionals in Bitcoin acquired the knowledge of Bitcoin in the forum, so since other's have made it by learning and understand the technology of Bitcoin, I wish to have the same knowledge through your guidelines and directives. I need article's to read of Bitcoin and I'm ready to learn the things of Bitcoin.

comments.author: Cantsay
comments.created_time: August 12, 2023, 01:06:04 AMLast edit: August 12, 2023, 08:57:53 PM by Cantsay
comments.body: You name sounds kinda funny ngl.Op you’re welcome to Bitcointalk, I take it that you already gone through the rules of the forum and if you haven’t done that already, then click here.You can also check out the following links to help you get started with your bitcoin learning journey. https://github.com/bitcoinbook/bitcoinbook#chapters https://coindesk.com/learn https://learnmeabitcoin.com/ https://www.bitcoin.com/get-started/You can also check this thread by Ratimov it did help me a lot when I came to the forum newly. Beginners & Help Encyclopedia

comments.author: lovesmayfamilis
comments.body: Your early posts tell us that you are not bad at navigating; why do you need another topic? In addition, your nickname is quite funny; it implies that its owner has a sense of humor as well as the ability to learn.Try to learn how to search for all the questions you are interested in using the search. And only after you do not find answers should you create a new topic. Try to match your name. https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5276341.0Two useful topics, after which, after reading and understanding, you will definitely become literate in the field of bitcoins.https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5364418.msg58120908#msg58120908https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5277049.0

comments.author: Upgrade00
comments.body: Expect to be overwhelmed with lots of helpful links, to avoid burning out, make a plan of what you want to learn. There's a lot to the technology of Bitcoin and how the network works and it will take a lot of time to have a grasp of everything about it bearing in mind that some changes happen overtime.Go from the simple aspects of Bitcoin to the complex gradually working your way up when you've fully understand the basics of it. And take it one step at a time. Never rush the process of learning and understand that you will always be learning.The more experienced members here also still learn from each other.

comments.author: mk4
comments.body: Bitcointalk isn't necessarily the best place to research as a beginner, but a damn good place to ask questions. (Google your question first before asking to prevent redundant questions).* If you like reading articles: https://coindesk.com/learn* If you like reading books: https://theinternetofmoney.info/* If you like watching videos: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLPQwGV1aLnTuN6kdNWlElfr2tzigB9NnjSecurity related:* https://chainsec.io* https://www.lopp.net/bitcoin-information/security.htmlIf you want to get more technical* https://github.com/bitcoinbook/bitcoinbook#chapters

Above is how you inserted your own reply into the quoted text of Cantsay or overwritten a [/quote] with your own reply, effectively putting words into Cantsay's quote the user never expressed. Below is how it should've looked like, except that I quote your text.Quote from: Smartgoat on August 12, 2023, 07:17:03 AMQuote from: Cantsay on August 12, 2023, 01:06:04 AMYou name sounds kinda funny ngl.I have seen the things you send to me, that will help me grow here. thanks you so much, for the name, forget about the name sir and give me other supports that will help me grow in this forum sir.Please, pay attention to correct quoting! Correct quoting from your own perspective in above example looks like this, your reply has to be put outside the quoted [quote...] and matching closing [/quote]!Code:[quote author=Cantsay link=topic=5462991.msg62683243#msg62683243 date=1691802364]<quoted text from user Cantsay>[/quote]<your own response to quoted text from user Cantsay>

comments.author: Lucius
comments.body: QuoteI'm new here, I need to know BTCThis is completely wrong thinking, because you are obviously under the influence of someone who filled your head with ideas about how Bitcoin is some kind of magical internet money and that there is a forum where you get that same Bitcoin just for writing some posts. Considering that it took you a week to find this board (if we assume that you actively used the forum), then you should first learn how to use the forum, and then you can learn all the basics of Bitcoin in a very short time.If you are interested in anything (including Bitcoin), there is a very useful feature called search engine, just type what you are interested in and hit enter

comments.author: Lakai01
comments.body: Quote from: Jones Praise on August 12, 2023, 06:06:00 PM~In my opinion, one of these rules should also be "Use the 'Preview' button before submitting the post". So one would recognize wrong quotations and wrong formatting immediately and could still correct the posting. If you have forgotten to do this and/or simply do not have the time to do so, it also helps to proofread the post you have just written after you have sent the post. If you notice errors at this point you can still use the edit button and correct the errors. @OP You have already been recommended a lot of links, I personally agree with the first poster and would also recommend the very good thread(s) and postings of Ratimov. So you get a very good overview of what Bitcoin is, how Bitcoin works technically and why Bitcoin is so ingenious. Besides that ... What are your main areas of interest? Are you interested in the technical background of Bitcoin and Cryptocurrencies in general?Are you interested in investment options?... or are you also interested in projects that are not directly related to Bitcoin but are in the cryptocurrency area?

comments.author: Sim_card

Forum members that post earlier have provided you with a lot of topics and article that can help you grow in knowledge on bitcoin. You should read them and make your own research to be very sure of what you want to know. We all started like you and it isn't something new,you can grow fast if you give more time to learning than posting. Don't forget to use the search engine to look for topics that you want to know about.Welcome to the forum
